intro: Navarretia viscidula, commonly known as the sticky navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, rounded seed pods that contain numerous tiny, oval seeds. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Navarretia viscidula is adapted to arid environments and is typically found in coastal and inland regions of California.
